comment.text: Sulfotransferase that utilizes 3'-phospho-5'-adenylyl sulfate (PAPS) as sulfonate donor to catalyze the sulfate conjugation of catecholamines, phenolic drugs and neurotransmitters. Has also estrogen sulfotransferase activity. responsible for the sulfonation and activation of minoxidil. Is Mediates the metabolic activation of carcinogenic N-hydroxyarylamines to DNA binding products and could so participate as modulating factor of cancer risk.
3'-phosphoadenylyl sulfate + a phenol = adenosine 3',5'-bisphosphate + an aryl sulfate.
Liver, lung, adrenal, brain, platelets and skin.

feature.description: In allele SULT1A1*2; common polymorphism; has a lower activity; dbSNP:rs9282861.
Increased sensitivity of enzyme activity to heat inactivation.
